Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: ozfamilyof4
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do - don't stay here. It is filthy, disgusting and tried to ruin our visit to Singapore. Even with a budget, we decided to leave after having paid for last night as we couldn't stand it any longer. We wondered about catching something and also wondered if we might be dirtier coming out of the bathroom than before going in to shower. Reception staff we very nice but it is disgusting. Extremely noisy, plastic covered mattresses made it hot, especialy when covered by sheets with holes in them. What more needs to be said - nothing - don't bother. Pay a little bit extra and enjoy your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and too expensive for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: MagpieJB
Reviews.Content: It is what it is. A budget hotel ideal for a short stay. I only needed a place to sleep on a stopover in Singapore. Yes it's small etc, but that's what I was expecting so it wasn't a concern. There is NEVER an excuse for dirty, filthy unkept rooms however. The bathroom was covered in mould and the floors obviously had not been cleaned for a long time. The rooms smell like cigarettes but that is to be expected I suppose. It served it's purpose but for SG$80 a night, it should be clean at the very least. Cheap cab ride to the airport (between SG$12-15) but I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “"Cheap" in a very expensive city, but what is the cheapest is usually the worst.”
Reviews.Author: Bart3939
Reviews.Content: Got a cheap hotel since I was in SIngapore only for the weekend. The desk staff was nice, but the room had no windows, smelled musty, the sheets were scratchy, no shower curtain, could not control the air (too cold), and it was very noisy at night (which I found out later it is in the prostitution district of Singapore... There is really not much in the area, the only saving grace was the Paya Lebar Metro stop is about 15 minutes away. Pay a iittle more money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a top city”
Reviews.Author: RPAPKPMP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is based a short way out of the city centre but is only a 15 minute walk to the nearest sky train stop, then 20 minutes into the centre. Based in a predominantly Malay area it gave a real insight into the real Singapore rather then just the usual tourist trails. Worth knowing that the road is at the end of the red light district but this had no impact on our stay at all and felt safe at all times even late at night. Very helpful staff, the room was just what you need in Singapore and it was great value for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Safe”
Reviews.Author: BulanBaiduri
Reviews.Content: The room/hotel is clean. The food / cafe is just around the corner. The MRT station is walking distant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, economical; spoiled by lingering cigarette smell and average service”
Reviews.Author: MG5554
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights (11-15 March 2011) and booked 2 rooms (superior double room); we were given rooms 405 and 406 Rooms were clean but not that spacious (as expected). Upon entering the rooms, there was this rather strong, unpleasant smell of cigarette smoke filling the air, i thought it was just me but my wife in the next room also said the same thing. For the next 2 nights, i was woken up by my asthmatic attacks and had to take my inhalers (which i brought along and had not been used for quite a while); most probably triggered by the cigarette-smelling air in the room. On Day 2, noticed that the TV in my room (405) was unable to view a number of channels that were available in room 406; made a complaint but they were unable to fix that problem. At the same time, the air con in my room stopped working and I was relocated to another room ( 111 ) which was bigger. Room 111 had the same problem of strong cigarette smell and the bathroom emits a rather unpleasant odor (however TV channels reception were similar to 406). Although 111 was a bigger room, but it had no windows (imagine being in a confined space with unpleasant cigarette smell lingering in the air) ! On Day 3, we left the hotel for an outing at 1030am ; got back to the hotel at 630pm and was informed that room 111 was not made up yet ! We left again for dinner at 8pm and I had to specifically remind the front desk to get the room done before we got back around 10pm (not impressed!); however it didn't happen again on subsequent days. There was no free parking or discounted rates provided for guests; parking is provided at a basement carpark in the next building at a rate of 80c per hr (7am -5pm) and SGD2 per entry (5pm - 7am) ; which would total up to SGD10 per 24hrs (if the car is just left parked there) Food outlets were aplenty within close vicinity of the hotel and especially Halal restaurants for Moslems ; which was the reason for choosing this hotel. However, for next trip, will consider elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Room - different sizes within the same hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaddyistheBest
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Deluxe Room on both stays, in June 2009 and November 2010. For my June 2009 stay, I mentioned in a previous review that it quite big, about 200 square feet. When I checked in for my stay this time (Nov 2010), I was given 2 choices - without widows, but larger, or with windows, which would be smaller. I went for the latter, and now report that their Deluxe Rooms have different sizes - the one I stayed in this time measured only around 150 square feet. Look at the photos I posted and you'll see the difference! Like the other room, this one also came with a mini-fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: papaija2008
Reviews.Content: We (I, my wife and our 9 months child) stayed one night here one our way to Bali. I have no complaints, the hotel was just fine for the short stay and definetely value for money (we payed 44USD incl. taxes). The location is good, about 15-20 mins from/to the airport. We didn't use MRT but I suppose it's only a few hundred meters from the hotel. On the other side of the road is Geyland Serai Market with a food court/market where we had dinner (6SGD / dish). The room was pretty clean, had a tv, minifridge, aircon, ok bed, hot water etc. and it was noise free. I could stay there again for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Irresponsible Management”
Reviews.Author: Aboo90
Reviews.Content: If you're planing to check in with this hotel, just don't! Unless you really have to. I booked the hotel for 3 nights upon arrival on 14th and upon the 2nd night i was told that i had to leave the room! reason given that somebody else had reserved the room since 1st of July and the system wasn't showing the slot on the computer so i wasn't told on the check-in date! So they offered me another 2 rooms with no windows that would have ended up much more expensive for me and my family! so we just checked out and spent our money on a family room at Fragrance Hotel for the last night which was much cleaner and had a great service. Location wise it's not exactly the city center nor it is a prime location but at least is close to public transport. However, in Singapore, where ever you wish to stay is close to some sort of public transport. Some rooms don't have windows that can be really depressing so make sure you get a room with a window if ever. Payed around 130 sqd per night for a family suit room but that's even considered expensive in regard to the location, comfort and service quality. I finally ended up in Fragrance Hotel Emerald down the same road and it was much cheaper for 89 sqd per night for a family room. Fragrance was much cleaner, had friendlier staff and really helped us out even when we were one person extra in a 3 beded room.

Reviews.Title: “highly overprized, very cheap facility”
Reviews.Author: magmur
Reviews.Content: We are used on budget accomodations around asia and we don't expect european standards, we stayed at several 81 hotels before for around 45USD. Now it was prized at 80USD and it's not worth it, a very tiny room with a short bed only180 cm in length, we are 2 normal sized europeans and really had a problem with that, 'chinese cleanliness' you better take of your glasses especially in the bathroom, good was the aircon and a really good hot shower, the rooms don't have windows but that keeps noise away. The surrounding is funny mixed ,malay and chinese ,some nice local restaurants, 2 7/11shops around the corner, no internet, no fridge and a plastic covered mattress which I found very uncomfortable as the bed sheet will not stay attached, the staff promised to solve it with a fitted sheet but that didn't happen.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely The WORST”
Reviews.Author: Flashpacker60
Reviews.Content: We got the hotel off the internet and looked just what we wanted. We pre-booked and reserved a room for late arrival. This was confirmed as a Superior Room by the hotel. We arrived at about 01.00 and checked in and were shown to our room. It was the worst room we have ever had in a so called reputable hotel chain. The room was so small there was no room for our luggage on the floor; you couldn't get into the bathroom if the wardrobe door was open; the mattress was covered in a plastic sheet which meant all the bed clothes slipped off; although it was meant to be a no-smoking room the place stank of cigarettes; there was no window in the room. The room was nothing like the photos on the web site. Being tired after a long journey we slept as best we could for the night but in the morning complained to the manager. We were told they had no better rooms but for an extra charge we could move to a sister hotel virtually next door which, as we had paid for 3 nights was the best we could get and were told that we could complain later which we did. When we complained we were told that there was nothing they could do as we should have complained the night we checked in and despite our protestations the management refused any refund at all. We later found out that this is what is commonly called a “short time hotel” catering for ladies of the night and their clients. We have since written several times to the Managing Director of the Hotel 81 chain but not had the courtesy of a reply. If you want an hotel in Singapore don’t book the Hotel 81 Classic; it is awful and without doubt the worst hotel we have ever stayed in on our travels. Do learn from our mistake and check reviews on Trip Advisor before you book any hotel and if in doubt try and get an independent review.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small and Basic”
Reviews.Author: firsttime4me2
Reviews.Content: If all you want is a bed and bathroom this is the place. However the bed has a plastic under-sheet which can be uncomfortable! 10mins walk to MRT and about halfway between airport and town center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DaddyistheBest
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Deluxe Room, which came with a window and mini-fridge - these aren't available in most of the Superior rooms. The rate was SGD79 nett per night flat - no weekend surcharge imposed since I was staying for so many nights i.e. 10. The room was very spacious for a hotel that is in the budget hotel category - about 200 square feet, which is close to twice the size of what you'd get in some budget hotels (remember: real estate in Singapore is among the most expensive in the world!). Getting from Changi Airport to the hotel by taxi took some 15-20 minutes, and cost SGD14 (including SGD3 airport surcharge). Room was clean, and was serviced every day. Did not notice any cigarette smoke odor, and if I recall correctly, smoking was not permitted. The hotel's location in its immediate vicinity is excellent - near a main road bus stop (with buses going to Orchard Road, Chinatown, VivoCity, amongst others) and also a MRT station (Paya Lebar). Also nearby are various eateries, including a hawker centre (where meals can be had for real cheap!). Also nearby, at Joo Chiat Complex, is a supermarket, which is useful for those who want to buy beer, drinks, snacks, etc. - that's where the Deluxe Room's mini-fridge also comes in handy! Remember, this is a budget hotel, so one has to know what one needs (and also doesn't need!) before rating it. In my case, it was on the whole excellent value for money!
